bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, February 27, 1920

div1.p: Carter describes his trip to New York and discusses travel plans to South America. He also writes about financial matters.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, February 27, 1920
div1.opener:
HOTEL PENNSYLVANIA NEW YORK
Operated by
Hotels Statler Co.
Inc.
UNDER
SAME MANAGEMENT
HOTELS STATLER
BUFFALO
430 ROOMS, 450 BATHS
CLEVELAND
1000 ROOMS, 1000 BATHS
DETROIT
1000 ROOMS, 1000 BATHS
ST. LOUIS
650 ROOMS, 650 BATHS
OPPOSITE PENNSYLVANIA TERMINAL

E.M. STATLER, PRESIDENT
ROY CARRUTHERS, MANAGER
Feb 27/ 20 (3.25 P. M)
My Dear Daughter:
div1.p:
Got lunch at in Dining Car; checked
both trunks to the Alliança-got a Porter
to carry my luggage-via a subway-to Hotel
Penn (50 cents): got a room-sent lug-
gage to it & took taxi to 61. Broadway-ar-
riving there not at the office- 27th to floor-at
4.1 1.45 i.e. took 39 minutes-counting 3 or 4
minutes getting off the train for all the a-
above,

Met Mr Lund, & have transportation, aboard
Alliança to Colon & to agent of Any line from
Colon to Callao, Three lines run. P. steam: chilenos
2
Peruvian-but not very regularly. Will
take the first s.s. sailing

Gorgas left Panama yesterday - so he
wired. I will meet him then at Callao &
may possibly, be only a week behind
him; depends on what connection I
make on the south steamer. He or I. or both
may stop at Guayaquil. If he does & I
don't I will gain one or two days on him:
if the reverse I lose.

I am to take charge of some of Noguchi's Y.F.
serum for O'Connor at Guayaquil-either
taking it direct - or having it with Grubbs
to go down by some boat that stops there if
mine does not. Also some for a Dr Klingler- from the R. Institute who was
with Noguchi at Merida & who is now with
3
Gorgas:

Am to meet Heiser tomorrow
at 9. A.M at 61. Broadway - he is in
Wickliffe Rose's place tempo-
rarily - to talk over some busi-
ness-& go to the dock at 10 A.M.
The vessel does not sail un-
til 3 P.M. That will allow
time enough to see about my
baggage- I have the labels
for it. I have time enough
to go now- this afternoon - but
I doubt if it has arrived at the
dock
4
dock yet. It should be there
by 10.30 or 11 A. M.-which will be a-
bout the time I get there.

So far everything has worked out
as smoothly as possible

Two things only (1) I should know
what Mrs Bennett charged for
the Passport photograph- In Galveston
it was only $100. 1 00/100, (2) I have charged
$1.00: excess value & weight of baggage
because H. gave the chauffeur $1.00

& he returned no change. If he paid
more
5
more - he will tell you if he did-
advise me. & I will charge it

Transfer here is $1.00 for piece=used to
be $.40 cents- That is too much rise & I
hope the Penn. R. R. will again in-
stall their own transfer-(at say about
.75 cents) when the R. R. go back
to private owners- Had I come up
tomorrow night I had come
up under private ownership- as
they go back at 12.01 A.M March 1/20

Going to Callao give me a chance to
get your Vicuña. I pray God you
may have opportunity to rest & good
opportunity- and may avail
yourself
6
yourself of it,

Love to Mary-whose foot is get-
ting better & which I hope will soon
be well. Also to Tumpsey .Henry:
Eddie & to Jennie, How did Helen's people f'nally come out with
the influenza

This time tomorrow I ought to
be going down the harbor-
Don't know if we stop at Haiti or
no. Love to yourself my Dear. I
think I have left very
few “loose ends”
